pageContent: Background: DNA methylation has been hypothesized as a mechanism for explaining the association between smoking and adverse prostate cancer (PCa) outcomes. This study was aimed at assessing whether smoking is associated with prostate tumor DNA methylation and whether these alterations may explain in part the association of smoking with PCa recurrence and mortality.

metaData.source:
Long-term prostate-specific antigen velocity in improved classification of prostate cancer risk and mortality
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23398767/
